name: Canopeo
short: One of the Grand Prize winners of the Google Fit Developers Challenge!! Fitness app that aggregates multiple trackers for competing with friends.
description: fit•hub was one of the Grand Prize winners of the Google Fit Developers Challenge!!

Syncs multiple accounts into one single dataset or allow users to view them individually. fit•hub can only read data from the official apps for each fitness tracker and can not be used in substitution of them.
Allows users with different fitness trackers to compete among themselves.

technologies.name: Android
usage: This app was first developed as an Android only app for the Google fit Contest.
The current Android implementation is developed using modern Android principles for efficient data usage.
The app uses Dagger 2 for dependency injection, RXJava, OkHttp3 and Retrofit 2 for it's data retrieval. The local cache uses SQLite enhanced with SQLBrite to be able to perform reactive queries.

technologies.name: Node JS
usage: The server stack is completely developed in NodeJS with Mongo DB.
Tasks done by the server include syncing of user fitness data and push notifications to the phone as well as taking care of storing the data in a Mongo DB instance.
Data analysis is also done by NodeJS to find trends on fitness usage to be used on future features of the app.
All the charts in the app were made using MPAndroidChart with a modified Data Renderer to allow for more interesting charts.
The app also makes use of Google API's to retrieve Google Fit data, User Authentication and Firebase messaging.

technologies.name: iOS / Swift
usage: Currently under development. The release date is estimated to be mid November.
The iOS app is completely developed in Swift 3.
The app uses the Material framework by CosmicMind for the UI Layer.
The data layer uses Alamofire to perform network requests and Realm for on-device data persistence.
